classifier_improvement.json_critique: Improving the baseline network goes beyond the paper’s stated methodology and does not correspond to any reported result; it is only loosely connected to the paper’s goals.
satellite_fractions.json_critique: Reproduces headline fraction numbers but relies on a prepared CSV of classifications instead of recreating detection, so difficulty is reduced.
satellite_chance_post2020_uvis.json_crit: Task recreates the paper’s ‘chance of seeing a satellite’ metric with correct normalisation, but uses supplied data rather than deriving detections.
satellite_fractions_increase.json_critiq: Captures a quoted result (growth of contamination) yet depends only on simple aggregation of provided labels.
paper_critique: Tasks cover training the principal ML model and reproducing the main statistical results (fractions and chances) for both instruments, representing a substantial portion of the paper, but omit other key components such as the AutoML composite-image pipeline, sky-position analysis, filter dependence and future-forecast modelling.
paper_title: The impact of satellite trails on Hubble Space Telescope observations
